scenario:
Wall Street's fourth-quarter earnings season begins next week with notable names such as JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. The earnings season gathers momentum in the final week of January when mega-cap tech companies, including Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Apple, release their quarterly updates.

Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth. The Financial sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%. The sector includes high-profile companies such as JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Visa, Mastercard, and American Express.

The Information Technology sector is forecast to report the second-highest annualized earnings growth rate, at +20.7%. Some of the biggest names in the sector include tech giants such as Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Broadcom, Salesforce, Oracle, Cisco, ServiceNow, and IBM.

In contrast, earnings from the Energy sector, which includes oil and gas giants such as ExxonMobil, Chevron, ConocoPhillips, EOG Resources, Schlumberger, and Kinder Morgan, are expected to tumble -24.6% compared to last year - the worst drop of any sector by far.

The sector is projected to report the second-worst Y-o-Y earnings slump of all eleven sectors, with EPS set to decline -3.8% from a year earlier, per FactSet. Notable names include GE Aerospace, Caterpillar, RTX, Boeing, Lockheed Martin, Honeywell International, and Deere.

Thirty-eight stocks are forecast to deliver growth of more than 25% in both earnings per share and revenue, including Astera Labs, Nvidia, Coinbase, Super Micro Computer, Reddit, Robinhood, Seagate, Western Digital, AppLovin, Trade Desk, DraftKings, CrowdStrike, Cloudflare, Snowflake, and Palantir.

Some other notable stocks to watch for that are also projected to deliver double-digit Q4 earnings and sales growth include Eli Lilly, Newmont, Jeffries Financial, Blackstone, Prudential Financial, Affirm, Axon Enterprise, Comfort Systems, Toast, and On Holding.
